listing.description: ****extended detached property****This fantastic detached home is perfectly located being just a short walk from Kingsway shops as well as within easy walking distance of the town centre. Rugby train station is a twenty minute walk with it's high speed links to London Euston and there is easy access to M1/M6 motorways. Situated in this part of Dunchurch Road you are in the catchment areas for several well regarded primary and secondary schools.The property has been greatly extended over recent years and offers spacious and versatile accommodation. There is the potential to adapt part of the ground floor to give almost self contained living for an elderly or disabled person or simply the ability to use any of the ground floor reception rooms as additional bedrooms for a large family or individuals working from home needing office space.In brief the accommodation to the ground floor comprises: Large entrance hall, spacious lounge with wood burning stove and feature built in aquarium, breakfast kitchen, wet room, family bathroom and three additional good sized reception rooms which can be used as required. To the first floor is a master bedroom with ensuite, three further double bedrooms and second family bathroom.Externally the property has a graveled driveway accessed through wrought iron double gates providing parking for several cars and direct access to a detached double garage. The rear garden is enclosed and mainly laid to lawn, has a paved patio and seating area and there is an additional decked area to the side of the property.Internal viewing is highly recommended to fully appreciate the fantastic and versatile space this home has to offer.

listing.description: A stunning four double bedroomed detached family home, with rear views over open fields, situated in the heart of one of Warwickshire's most sought after villages.The house benefits from under floor heating downstairs and gas-fired central heating upstairs. Accommodation includes: Entrance hall to lounge, cloakroom, access directly to the garage, kitchen/dining room/snug area and a Utility leading out to the side of the property with stairs leading to the first floor bedrooms, two having en-suites and a family bathroom. Shared driveway leading to a single integral garage, and additional parking for several vehicles.Location - Easenhall is a particularly attractive and sought-after village, situated around 4.5 miles to the North West of Rugby and approx. 6 miles to Coventry.The village has a community hall, the renowned Golden Lion Hotel and Restaurant and access to stunning countryside at your doorstep. There is a school bus pick up and drop off to The Revel Primary School in the nearby village of Monks Kirby and many Rugby Secondary Schools along Main Street.Day-to-day shopping facilities can be found approximately 2 miles away in Brinklow, 6 miles to The Warwickshire Shopping Centre in Coventry, and at Elliott Fields and Juntion 1 Retail Park.Easenhall's central position provides excellent access to the M1, M6, M69, A5, A45 and A14. With a Virgin Train service from Rugby arriving in Euston London in well under one hour.The home should be occupied by an Approved Person who can demonstrate an established connection to the Parish of Easenhall and surrouding parishes. Call for more information.There is easy access to The University Hospital Coventry at just 7.8 miles away and Rugby St Cross Hospital being just 5.1 miles.This bespoke property will be built around Spring 2018 so now is the time to think about putting your property on the market in time to choose your very own kitchen and bathrooms and move in to your perfect new home.
listing.short_description: A stunning four double bedroomed detached family home, with rear views over open fields, situated in the heart of one of Warwickshire's most sought after villages. The house benefits from under floor heating downstairs and gas-fired central heating upstairs. Accommodation includes: Entrance hall to lounge, cloakroom, access directly to the garage, kitchen/dining room/snug area and a Utility leading out to the side of the property with stairs leading to the first floor bedrooms, two having en-suites and a family bathroom. Shared driveway leading to a single integral garage, and additional parking for several vehicles. Location - Easenhall is a particularly attractive and sought-after village, situated around 4.5 miles to the North West of Rugby and approx. 6 miles to Coventry. The village has a community hall, the renowned Golden Lion Hotel and Restaurant and access to stunning countryside at your doorstep. There is a school bus pick up and drop off to The Revel Primary School in the nearby village of Monks Kirby and many Rugby Secondary Schools along Main Street. Day-to-day shopping facilities can be found approximately 2 miles away in Brinklow, 6 miles to The Warwickshire Shopping Centre in Coventry, and at Elliott Fields and Juntion 1 Retail Park. Easenhall's central position provides excellent access to the M1, M6, M69, A5, A45 and A14. With a Virgin Train service from Rugby arriving in Euston London in well under one hour. The home should be occupied by an Approved Person who can demonstrate an established connection to the Parish of Easenhall and surrouding parishes. Call for more information. There is easy access to The University Hospital Coventry at just 7.8 miles away and Rugby St Cross Hospital being just 5.1 miles. This bespoke property will be built around Spring 2018 so now is the time to think about putting your property on the market in time to choose your very own kitchen and bathrooms and move in to your perfect new home.

listing.description: Luxury on a grand scale this beautiful home looks great from all directions and is suitable for a wide range of buyers! Immaculately presented throughout with so many plus points including the two large En-suites, huge living kitchen with island unit and bay with french doors leading out to the immaculately groomed gardens to rear! And that's before we mention the highly sought after location in close proximity to the centre of this delightful village with its excellent schools! Accommodation comprises hall, cloakroom/WC, lounge, dining room, living kitchen, utility room, landing, master bedroom, walk in dressing room, En-suite, bedroom two, En-suite, two further bedrooms and family bathroom. Externally the property has a drive to front with single garage beyond and beautiful split level garden to rear. Viewing is strongly recommended! EPC Grade D.LocationSought after and picturesque Burbage is a popular village on the outskirts of Hinckley. The village offers a small library, two infant schools, the first Britannia Scout group, two junior schools and a secondary school. It also holds its popular farmers market on the first Saturday of every month. There are various public houses, restaurants, a small supermarket an individual boutique shops.Our ViewExceptional in every way whether its Location, Schools, Presentation or Accommodation that's driving your decision this home really will tick all your boxes! Viewing is strongly recommended.Reception Hall (2.67m x 7.39m)Cloakroom / WC (1.47m x 0.97m)Lounge (3.23m x 7.62m)Dining Room (2.84m x 3.48m)Living Kitchen (6.05m x 3.58m)Utility Room (1.65m x 2.44m)1st Floor Landing (4.32m x 5.89m)Master Bedroom (3.25m x 4.24m)Walk In Dressing Room (2.67m x 1.37m)En-Suite Shower Room (2.51m x 2.08m)Bedroom 2 (3.28m x 4.37m)En-Suite Bathroom (2.82m x 3.91m)Bedroom 3 (2.82m x 5.89m)Bedroom 4 (2.69m x 3.66m)Family Bathroom (1.65m x 2.44m)Important note to purchasers:We endeavour to make our sales particulars accurate and reliable, however, they do not constitute or form part of an offer or any contract and none is to be relied upon as statements of representation or fact. Any services, systems and appliances listed in this specification have not been tested by us and no guarantee as to their operating ability or efficiency is given. All measurements have been taken as a guide to prospective buyers only, and are not precise. Please be advised that some of the particulars may be awaiting vendor approval. If you require clarification or further information on any points, please contact us, especially if you are traveling some distance to view. Fixtures and fittings other than those mentioned are to be agreed with the seller./3

listing.description: Summarylocation location location!This double bay fronted period property is located in Leamington Spa town centre. The property has retained many character features and also benefits from a Two-Chamber cellar. There is space for a Rangemaster cooker and space for fridge/freezer. The kitchen also benefits from a radiator and a double glazed window to side elevation.Utility Room 8' 5" x 9' 7" ( 2.57m x 2.92m )Fitted with base units and a stainless steel sink and drainer unit and the central heating boiler. There is space and plumbing for a washing machine, space for tumble dryer, space for fridge, a double glazed window to rear elevation and a door leading to the Courtyard Garden.First Floor Landing The stairs lead form hallway with a radiator.Bedroom One 16' 9" max into bay x 17' 8" max ( 5.11m max into bay x 5.38m max )A generously sized bedroom fitted with a wash hand basin, a radiator and a window to front elevation.Bedroom Two 13' max x 11' 5" ( 3.96m max x 3.48m )A good sized bedroom with a radiator, wash hand basin and window to rear elevation.Bedroom Three 5' 6" plus recess x 8' 11" ( 1.68m plus recess x 2.72m )The third bedroom benefits from built in wardrobes, a radiator and a window to rear elevation.BathroomFitted with a two piece suite comprising of a wash hand basin and bath with shower over. The bathroom also benefits from tiling to splash back areas, vinyl flooring, a radiator and a window to side elevation.Separate WcFitted with a low level WC, vinyl flooring and a window to side elevation.Second Floor LandingThe stairs lead from the first floor landing with a storage cupboard.Bedroom Four 11' 1" min x 10' 3" ( 3.38m min x 3.12m )With a radiator and a window to rear elevation.Outside Courtyard GardenThe Courtyard Garden is wall enclosed with a raised patio area, a shed and gated rear access.CellarWe understand from our vendor that there is a cellar with two chambers.Agent's NoteThe cellar has not been inspected by a member of Connells.1. listing.description: This fabulous, five bedroom, detached family home can be found in the sought after village of Binley Woods.This property blends character with modern touches, provides over 2436 square feet of space and must be viewed to fully appreciate the fine detailing and presentation. You will find plenty of local amenities available in all directions including village pubs, shops and open greens.The ground floor features: Large entrance hallway leading off to the impressive staircase positioned in the centre of the home, light and airy lounge with fitted log burner, dining room, playroom/study, beautiful fitted kitchen, utility room and downstairs shower room.The staircase brings you to the stunning landing which leads to five bedrooms, two of which have en-suite shower rooms, wonderful family bathroom offering both large bath and separate shower cubicle.To the front of the property is a large driveway providing off road parking for several vehicles and a large, mature rear garden with workshop.Energy Rating: CEntrance Hallway (4.79 x 2.0 (15'8" x 6'6"))Lounge (8.25 x 3.66 (27'0" x 12'0"))Dining Room (4.75m x 3.40m (15'7 x 11'2))Kitchen (3.51m x 4.06m (11'6 x 13'4))Utility Room (3.51m x 3.15m (11'6 x 10'4))Shower RoomStudy/Playroom (5.87 x 3.05 (19'3" x 10'0"))Landing (4.17 x 4.07 (13'8" x 13'4"))Bedroom One (4.32m x 4.57m (14'2 x 15'0))En Suite Shower RoomBedroom Two (3.73m x 3.71m (12'3 x 12'2))En Suite Shower RoomBedroom Three (2.62m x 4.57m (8'7 x 15'0))Bedroom Four (2.79m x 2.90m (9'2 x 9'6))Bedroom Five (3.20m x 3.71m (10'6 x 12'2))Bathroom (2.79m x 2.90m (9'2 x 9'6))Front DrivewayRear GardenGarage
listing.short_description:
This fabulous, five bedroom, detached family home can be found in the sought after village of Binley Woods. This property blends character with modern touches, provides over 2436 square feet of space and must be viewed to fully appreciate the fine detailing and presentation. You will find plenty of local amenities available in all directions including village pubs, shops and open greens. The ground floor features: Large entrance hallway leading off to the impressive staircase positioned in the centre of the home, light and airy lounge with fitted log burner, dining room, playroom/study, beautiful fitted kitchen, utility room and downstairs shower room. The staircase brings you to the stunning landing which leads to five bedrooms, two of which have en-suite shower rooms, wonderful family bathroom offering both large bath and separate shower cubicle. To the front of the property is a large driveway providing off road parking for several vehicles and a large, mature rear garden with workshop. Energy Rating: C

listing.description: A beautiful, extended four bedroom detached family home in the sought after village of Burbage, being centrally located, within walking distance to local schools, parks and amenities. This property has been finished to a high specification and boasts:- solid oak windows, doors and skirting boards throughout- large, breakfast kitchen & utility leading into a spacious family room with bi-fold doors overlooking the rear garden- study/home office- dining hall- sitting room- master bedroom wtih fitted solid, oak wardrobes and fully tiled en-suite shower room- spacious family bathroom- 3 further bedrooms- large, landscaped, picturesque, rear garden with extensive patio - perfect for entertaining- log cabin with side veranda- off road parking for up to 3 cars- cctv and alarmGround FloorEntrance to the property is at the front via a solid oak front door into a tiled porch area leading to......A spacious dining hall with two large oak picture windows to the side elevation. Featuring an easy tread oak and glass staircase with a useful under stair cupboard. Oak, partial glazed double doors lead through to a ...Sitting room located at the front of the property, with a large bay solid oak window. Featuring a wood burning stove, with an oak mantle and slate hearth.Also off the dining hall, located at the front of the property, is the Study/home office, with broadband and telephone points and window overlooking the driveway.The open plan breakfast kitchen and family room has a range of bespoke, handmade, solid oak, base and wall units, with granite worktops over and tile inset. There is a belfast sink with Quooker tap for instant boiling water. The kitchen also benefits from a Stoves range style double oven with seven ring gas hob with extractor hood over, integrated double dishwasher and space and plumbing for an American style fridge freezer.The utility room is off the breakfast kitchen with two oak fitted cupboards for further storage and granite counter top, with space and plumbing for a washing machine and tumble dryer under. The guest w.C. Is accessed off the utility room with white w.C .And hand basin.The breakfast kitchen leads to the spacious family room, perfect for entertaining, with large, oak, bi-fold doors looking and leading out onto the pituresque rear garden. Featuring LED spotlights, oak skirting and flooring, underfloor heating and t.V. Aeriel point.First FloorThe stairs lead off the dining hall onto the first floor landing. From here doors lead to...Bedroom 2 - a large double bedroom overlooking the front and side of the property. Featuring double glazed oak windows, oak door and skirting and ceiling height into the eaves.Bedroom 3 - a double bedroom overlooking the front of the property. Featuring double glazed oak windows, oak door and skirting with access to the loft space and ceiling height into the eaves.Bedroom 4 - a good sized single, with oak door and skirting and a Velux skylight.The spacious family bathroom has been refitted to a high specification, having a double ended bath with mood light and inbuilt speakers to connect to your iPod/iPad/iPhone. A walk in double shower cubicle with dual controls on the outside/inside of the cubicle. Heated towel rail and underfloor heating, LED spotlights, low level LED night lights, shaver point, porcelain tiles to floor and partial walls, built in storage cupboard housing Valiant Boiler and shelving for towels etc. And a Velux Skylight.Master bedroom - spacious master bedroom with cathedral roof, featuring floor to ceiling oak fitted wardrobes, 2 sets of oak French doors with wrought iron Juliet balconies overlooking the rear garden, oak skirting and door leading to.......En-Suite - including a walk in double shower with dual controls on the outside/inside of the cubicle, wc, his and hers hand basins housed in a double floating vanity unit. Floor to ceiling tiles, underfloor heating, heated towel rail, low level LED night lights, shaver socket, extractor fan and Velux skylight.OutsideTo the front of the property is a blockpaved and gravel driveway with ample car parking. There is access to the rear garden via the right hand side of the property through a brick arch and side gate.The larger than average rear garden is split into three areas. Comprising a landscaped, entertaining space, featuring a large granite patio area, perfect for private sunbathing and entertaining, pergola, 2 separate seating areas, log cabin & covered veranda and mature borders, leading through a covered pergola to a lawned area with fence and hedged boundaries which leads to an area which currently houses a trampoline, a mature apple tree and two sheds, but is perfect for a separate children's play area/garden room or a small allotment.The log cabin is ideal to use as a gym, teenage den or garden room with electric points and lighting. The covered side veranda attached to the log cabin also features electric points and lighting and has enough space to house a hot tub and seating area to relax and unwind.There is also an outside tap, double electric point, wall lights on rear of the property, garden lighting, CCTV and security lighting. All outside lighting/lighting to log cabin and veranda is controlled by a remote control handset.Local AreaThe property is situated on a popular road in the sought after village of Burbage.Burbage has a range of shops and amenities including a co-op late shop, hairdressers, flower shop, doctors and dentist surgeries, restaurants, takeaways and popular public houses within walking distance.The property is situated within the catchment area to Burbage Church of England Infant School, Ofsted rating (Good). For High schooling the property is within the catchment area for Hastings High School. Ofsted Rating (Outstanding)Hinckley town centre is within 3 miles, with a wider range of amenities including supermarkets, popular High street with a weekly market and the new Crescent development with bars, restaurants and cinema complex .The road links in the area make it an ideal location for commuters to the cities. With the A5, M69, M1 and M6 within easy reach.

This property has been finished to a high specification and boasts:  - solid oak windows, doors and skirting boards throughout - large, breakfast kitchen & utility leading into a spacious family room with bi-fold doors overlooking the rear garden - study/home office - dining hall - sitting room - master bedroom wtih fitted solid, oak wardrobes and fully tiled en-suite shower room - spacious family bathroom - 3 further bedrooms - large, landscaped, picturesque, rear garden with extensive patio - perfect for entertaining - log cabin with side veranda - off road parking for up to 3 cars - cctv and alarm

listing.description: A unique opportunity to purchase this fully renovated four-bedroom barn conversion offering over 2098 ft square (194 metre square) set in over an acre of land which benefits from a separate detached 80ft barn and paddock. This beautiful property has been tastefully designed through renovation giving the property character with many exposed oak beams. This property must be viewed to fully appreciate the space and it’s delightful finish.Briefly the property comprises of a spacious entrance hallway leading through to a superb kitchen breakfast room with fully fitted solid oak units, appliances and a feature log burner. There is a separate utility and cloakroom. From the kitchen you will find a large dining room with exposed oak beams which leads to a hallway that leads to a family bathroom and two double bedrooms with the master having a walk in wardrobe and en-suite facilities. Walking into a lighted hallway there are a further two double bedrooms and a lounge featuring charming exposed oak beams and bi-fold doors that open out to the garden.Briefly the property comprises of a spacious entrance hallway leading through to a superb kitchen breakfast room with fully fitted solid oak units, appliances and a feature log burner. There is a separate utility and cloakroom. From the kitchen you will find a large dining room with exposed oak beams which leads to a hallway that leads to a family bathroom and two double bedrooms with the master having a walk in wardrobe and en-suite facilities. Walking into a lighted hallway there are a further two double bedrooms and a lounge featuring charming exposed oak beams and bi-fold doors that open out to the garden.Entrance Hallway (4.34m x 3.96m (14'3 x 13))Kitchen (7.32m x 4.37m (24'65 x 14'4))Utility (3.66m x 2.92m (12 x 9'7))W/C (1.40m x 1.42m (4'7 x 4'8))Dining Room (5.66m x 4.37m (18'7 x 14'4))Master Bedroom (4.27m x 4.09m (14' x 13'5))Dressing Room (2.13m x 2.92m (7 x 9'7))En-Suite (3.05m x 1.45m (10 x 4'9))Bedroom 2 (5.49m x 3.28m (18 x 10'9))Bedroom 3 (2.74m x 3.05m (9 x 10))Bedroom 4 (2.74m x 3.05m (9 x 10))Bathroom (3.05m x 3.28m (10 x 10'9))Lounge (3.86m x 5.97m (12'8 x 19'7))Barn (Separate) (24.38m x 14.40m (80 x 47'3))

There is a separate utility and cloakroom. From the kitchen you will find a large dining room with exposed oak beams which leads to a hallway that leads to a family bathroom and two double bedrooms with the master having a walk in wardrobe and en-suite facilities. Walking into a lighted hallway there are a further two double bedrooms and a lounge featuring charming exposed oak beams and bi-fold doors that open out to the garden.

listing.short_description:
A superb opportunity to acquire a four bedroom detached home in a very popular semi-rural location. The property sits on a large plot and overlooks open countryside. This is a must see home and offers vast potential.

The property briefly comprises of entrance hall, huge lounge and dining room, kitchen breakfast room, study with bar, store room and downstairs wc, To the first floor are four double bedrooms, the master with en-suite, family bathroom and shower room. The property also benefits from a great sized rear garden, driveway and gardens to front. The property is offered with no upward chain and must be seen.

Entrance Hall

Having doors off to adjacent rooms and stairs rising to the first floor and central heating radiator.

Lounge Diner

Lounge Area (28'4" x 11'10 (8.64m x 3.61m))

Featuring a double glazed uPVC bay window to front, central heating radiator, gas fireplace with surround. Gas fire disconnected due to age.

Dining Area (16'0" max x 8'9" (4.88m max x 2.67m))

Having sliding patio doors to rear, central heating radiator and serving hatch through to kitchen.

Kitchen (14'11" x 13'10" (4.55m x 4.22m))

With a range of base and wall mounted units, tiled work surfaces, inset sink unit with mixer tap, four ring electric hob with extractor over, built in over, double glazed window to rear garden.

Study/Bar (12'8" x 7'11" (3.86m x 2.41m))

Having a bar, double glazed uPVC window to front, central heating radiator.

Store Room (24'8" x 7'9" (7.52m x 2.36m))

Landing

With doors off to adjacent bedrooms and bathroom, central heating radiator.

Master Bedroom (14'8" x 12'0" (4.47m x 3.66m))

Having built in wardrobes and cupboards, double glazed leaded window to front, central heating radiator and door through to:-

En-Suite

Having bath, low level wc, bidet, sink units and single glazed window to rear.

Guest Bedroom (16'11" x 9'3" (5.16m x 2.82m))

Having room for free standing furniture, built in wardrobes, double glazed bay window to front, central heating radiator.

Bedroom 3 (11'9" max x 11'9" (3.58m max x 3.58m))

Having built in wardrobes, double glazed window to rear overlooking fields and central heating radiator.

Bedroom 4 (11'7" x 8'4" (3.53m x 2.54m))

With central heating radiator, double glazed leaded window to front, small built-in wardrobe and cupboards.

Bathroom

Featuring a low level wc, pedestal hand wash basin, central heating radiator, tiled walls and obscured window to rear garden.

Garden

Having a large paved patio area including summer house and store shed. Delightful lengthy well stocked and secluded mainly lawned gardens with further storage shed situated to the rear being located next to local field, requiring a viewing to fully appreciate.

Drive

With off road parking for several vehicles, lawns and established borders.

As the sellers agent we are not surveyors or conveyancing experts and as such we cannot and do not comment on the condition of the property or issues relating to title or other legal issues that may affect this property, unless we have been made aware of such matters. Interested parties should employ their own professionals to make such enquiries before making any transactional decisions.

listing.description: An opportunity to purchase a Five bedroom Detached Property in the Sought after area of Binley Woods.This property has been well maintained throughout. Benefiting from a large entrance hall, lounge with log burner, dining room, play room/study, fitted kitchen with utility and downstairs shower room. The landing on the first floor is beautiful and leads to 5 bedrooms, 2 with en-suites and an amazing family bathroom with an extra large bath. The property really needs to be viewed to be appreciated. It is the perfect family home.To the rear of the property there is a large out-house split into separate rooms one as a work shop, the other as a games room. This home has a great sized garden and there is also ample parking.HallLounge (8.26m x 3.68m (27'1" x 12'1"))Kitchen/Breakfast Room (3.51m x 4.06m (11'6" x 13'4"))Utility (3.51m x 3.15m (11'6" x 10'4"))Shower RoomDining Room (4.75m x 3.40m (15'7" x 11'2"))Playroom/Study (5.84m max x 3.10m (19'2" max x 10'2"))First Floor LandingBedroom (4.32m max x 4.57m max (14'2" max x 15' max))En-SuiteBedroom (2.62m x 4.57m (8'7" x 15'))Bedroom (3.20m x 3.71m (10'6" x 12'2"))Bedroom (3.73m x 3.71m max (12'3" x 12'2" max))En-SuiteBedroom (2.79m x 1.96m (9'2" x 6'5"))Bathroom (2.79m x 2.90m (9'2" x 9'6"))Office Opening HoursThe normal opening hours of our Estate Agents office are: Monday - Friday 09:00 - 18:00 Saturday 09:00 - 16:30 Sunday 11:00 - 15:00Agents NoteAll measurements are approximate and quoted in metric with imperial equivalents and for general guidance only and whilst every attempt has been made to ensure accuracy, they must not be relied on. The fixtures, fittings and appliances referred to have not been tested and therefore no guarantee can be given that they are in working order. Internal photographs are reproduced for general information and it must not be inferred that any item shown is included with the property. All images and floorplans representing this property both online and offline by Newman Sales and Lettings are the copyright of Newman Sales and Lettings, and must not be duplicated without our expressed prior permissions. Free valuations available - contact Newman Estate Agents.

An opportunity to purchase a Five bedroom Detached Property in the Sought after area of Binley Woods. This property has been well maintained throughout. Benefiting from a large entrance hall, lounge with log burner, dining room, play room/study, fitted kitchen with utility and downstairs shower room. The landing on the first floor is beautiful and leads to 5 bedrooms, 2 with en-suites and an amazing family bathroom with an extra large bath. The property really needs to be viewed to be appreciated. It is the perfect family home. To the rear of the property there is a large out-house split into separate rooms one as a work shop, the other as a games room. This home has a great sized garden and there is also ample parking.
